intro: Celmisia robusta, commonly known as the mountain celmisia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are usually lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pale yellow. Celmisia robusta is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
